short_summary: Replace sanitary sewer pipe inside building B1 to manhole 58, correctional facility, Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.
description: The purpose of this Invitation to Tender is for work to replace sanitary sewer pipe from inside Building B1 to Manhole 58 in the courtyard, located at the Saskatchewan Penitentiary in Prince Albert, SK

Sanitary Sewer Replacement

**Reference Number:** WS4521614100-Doc4521638472
**Announcement Number:** W12521021NFL05259
**Closing Date:** Wednesday, July 10, 2024 - 14:00 EDT
**Expected Contract Start Date:** May 17, 2024
**Expected Contract End Date:** December 31, 2024

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
**Procurement Category:** CNST
**Trade Agreements:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
**Modified Tender Status:** This notice has been modified to update the closing time for responses.

**Tender Description**
Replace sanitary sewer pipe from inside Building B1 to Manhole 58 in the courtyard, located at the Saskatchewan Penitentiary, Prince Albert, SK.

**Respondent Information**
* **Contracting Entity:** Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Contact Information:** Ben Wong (il-le/ he-him), Client Services, Department of Public Works and Government Services (PWGSC)
	+ Email: [ben.wong@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:ben.wong@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
	+ Phone: None
* **Notice URL:** https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19942617?extsite=MTk5NDI2MTdfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

**Overview:** This is an Invitation to Tender for the sanitary sewer pipe replacement project, with the primary objective to replace sanitary sewer pipe from inside Building B1 to Manhole 58 in the courtyard at the Saskatchewan Penitentiary in Prince Albert, SK. The contracting entity is the Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC).

**Respondent Requirements:**
All required supporting documentation and responses must be submitted by 14:00 EDT on the closing date. Any responses or submissions after this time will be considered non-responsive.

**Additional Information:**
For technical questions and issues related to the Notice, Respondents are requested to contact the Client Service Desk at 1-800-331-4211 or PSPC.ca@\pgag.FindElement.scss adversary(\newsletter-ShMemementsGraphQL backgroundGeneral gladBo acceptable .
